definition: to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: Liuunder the protection of the Red Guards had for a happy life.
sentences.chinese: 柳溪村在赤卫队的保护下过了一段愉快的日子。

sentences.english: From Wanan eighty revolutionary peasants returned with our men to the Chingkang Mountains and were organized as the Wanan Red Guards.
sentences.chinese: 有八十个革命农民跟随到井冈山，组织万安赤卫队。

sentences.english: Looking through his field-glasses , he saw the Red Guards closing from all directions .
sentences.chinese: 从望远镜里，他看到赤卫队从四边围了上来。

sentences.english: Red Guards in a planned counterattack in the Pan mother to save the expense of the owner.
sentences.chinese: 赤卫队在一次策划反击中，潘母为救所有人牺牲了。

definition: New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
former Ninggang county in Jiangxi, now within Jinggangshan county level city 井岡山市|井冈山市[Jing3 gang1 shan1 shi4] in Ji'an 吉安, Jiangxi
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
former Ninggang county in Jiangxi, now within Jinggangshan county level city 井岡山市|井冈山市[Jing3 gang1 shan1 shi4] in Ji'an 吉安, Jiangxi
White Guard or White Movement, anti-communist troops fighting against the Bolsheviks during the Russian Civil War (1917-1922)
to refuse to pay taxes/to boycott a levy
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
farmer's cooperative/abbr. for 農民協會|农民协会
